column4: I've got an apparent bug in the update manager that I'm VERY unhappy about...
doubt it is "in the update manager"
shall I describe the bug?
I was thinking you would, but ball is ultimately in your court
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
what good does that do me? I'm on dial-up, It stands to reason that if 37 MB is a problem, 157 MB will be too...
do that command
well just sudo apt-get install whatever you want from those
it is a go to that link and see how to enable it
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FileCompression#head-6dd82717a35bf41459736ab63ba07a39875c0636
I am sure you can always do it from command line, let me see
you should be able to do p7zip -d whatever.7z
do I need to "cd" to the directory it's in before performing that command?
yeah, or you can just do "p7zip -d /path/to/whatever.7z"
right, they are codecs not plugins though, but yeah
but in order to play back DVDs and WMA/WMV I have to intstall from third party?
for encrypted dvds yes
sudo apt-get autoremove openoffice.org
I want to do it through Synaptic.
well then do it, why ask
Because it's giving me hassels.
